metadata.Title: CVE-2016-8666 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The IP stack in the Linux kernel before 4.6 allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (stack consumption and panic) or possibly haveunspecified other impact by triggering use of the GRO path for packets withtunnel stacking, as demonstrated by interleaved IPv4 headers and GREheaders, a related issue to CVE-2016-7039.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-8666` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-42.62
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-42.62
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1027-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1027.33
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1030-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1030.33
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-gke - 4.4.0-1003.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-42.62').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1027.33').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1030.33').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.8.0-36.36~16.04.1').
linux-gke package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
